title: The right 'man' for the job? The role of empathy in community librarianship
abstractText:
A project investigating public library staff attitudes towards social inclusion policy and disadvantaged groups in society. 
Tests the relationships between staffs own ethnicity, social, cultural and professional background and their capacity to make an effective, empathic contribution to social inclusion objectives. 
The extent, range and effectiveness of existing social inclusion initiatives will be considered. Research methods include a quantitative national survey; qualitative interviews and focus groups with a stratified sample of public library staff. Recommendations will be made concerning a best practice approach to social inclusion initiatives and effective staff recruitment, selection, training and professional development procedures.
